summary: This is an email chain from November 2019 between individuals, likely prosecutors or investigators, discussing scheduling a meeting to catch up on the Epstein case. The content references a meeting in California with a potential victim who is undecided about pursuing a criminal case, the inability to bring an enticement charge, and an upcoming limited proffer session with another individual.

events.title: Meeting in California with potential victim
events.description: A meeting was held in California with a potential victim. The meeting did not yield significant new information, and it was determined an enticement charge could not be brought. The victim was still undecided about pursuing a criminal case.

events.title: Upcoming limited proffer session
events.description: An individual is scheduled to come in for a limited proffer session to discuss their background, starting a week from the email date (Tuesday, November 26, 2019).

keyFacts: Investigators determined they 'almost certainly couldn't bring an enticement charge' against Epstein based on timing and location facts related to a specific potential victim.
A potential victim met with investigators in California but was still unsure about whether to pursue a criminal case; her attorneys were to be circled back with later in November 2019.
The potential victim did not want to discuss specific conduct during the California meeting, so no additional information was obtained.
Investigators were continuing to work through a 'pile of memos' as part of their ongoing investigation.
An individual was scheduled for a 'limited proffer' session to discuss their background, indicating ongoing cooperation negotiations.
